issue.title: Add mouse shortcuts besides keyboard ones
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Please, add a possibility to use mouse buttons as shortcuts, for example, long click on the middle (wheel) button could be used to "Show main window under mouse cursor".

To date, mice are not limited to 3 buttons, there are those that have up to 19 of them, and the number of combinations reaches up to 40. Of course, you can assign a specific keyboard shortcut to certain actions in CopyQ, and then use the mouse software to assign them to its buttons. But through keyboard shortcuts it is impossible to assign the duration of key presses, but the duration of mouse button presses can be registered, and therefore it will be much more convenient when you can assign 2 actions to one mouse button, for example, a long press of the middle button will perform "Show main window under mouse cursor", and a short click will perform "Show/hide main window".

issue.title: Cannot the font size of a clip's note
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When changing the font size of the clip's note through Settings -> Appearance, nothing happens.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Preference -> Appearance
2. Press Ctrl+F2 in order to enter into to the edit mode of the note's apparance
3. Firstly, try to find by touch or by trial and error the button that is responsible for editing the appearance of the note's font
4. After you find it, try to change the size or any other parameter of the font
5. As a result, no changes ultimately result in any alterations to the note's font.

**Expected behavior**
I expect to see, that the note's font would change its appearance in accordance with the introduced modifications.

**Screenshots**

[CopyQ-Notes-FontSize-Video_2023-10-27_101633.webm](https://github.com/hluk/CopyQ/assets/11407417/7f4ba6d3-d36a-48f5-80c8-db45cbbda6bd)

**Version, OS and Environment**
 - OS: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19045.2673] 64bit
 - Browser: Firefox 119.0 64bit
 - Browser: Chrome 118.0.5993.90 (Official Build) (64-bit)
 - Browser: Edge 118.0.2088.69 (Official build) (64-bit)

issue.title: Images are stored as text when copied from web browsers

My problem is exactly the same as mentioned in the following Post:

https://github.com/hluk/CopyQ/issues/1100

but the code that was given at it does not work for me. I don't know if it is a bug in new version of CopyQ or an incompatibility between CopyQ and the new version of my browser!?

When I press F4, the following formats are listed for my images:

text/plain
text/html

Thanks for any help
Best Regards

issue.title: ScriptError "TypeError Property 'text' Exit code 4"
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When I try to execute script the error " TypeError: Property 'text' Exit code: 4" appears.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Apply the following script to a clip that contains a note with a URL.
```
[Command]
Command="
    copyq:
    var url = input().text()
    if ( open(url) )
      popup('Opening URL', url)
    else
      popup('Failed to open URL', url)"
HideWindow=true
Icon=\xf0ac
InMenu=true
Input=application/x-copyq-item-notes
Name=Open in &Browser
```
2. See the aforementioned error.

**Expected behavior**
Opening the URL located in the clip note in the browser.

**Screenshots**

[CopyQ-Open-in-Browser-Video_2023-10-27_073333.webm](https://github.com/hluk/CopyQ/assets/11407417/27501586-b34f-413a-9516-0afaacc6d468)

**Version, OS and Environment**
 - CopyQ 7.1.0
 - OS: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19045.2673] 64bit
 - Browser: Firefox 119.0 64bit
 - Browser: Chrome 118.0.5993.90 (Official Build) (64-bit)
 - Browser: Edge 118.0.2088.69 (Official build) (64-bit)

issue.title: Pop not working on Ubuntu 22.04
issue.body:
Regarding [push/pop](https://github.com/hluk/CopyQ/issues/597#issuecomment-1728895131) that you've helpfully posted [here](https://github.com/hluk/copyq-commands/blob/master/Global/README.md#pushpop-items).

On Ubuntu 22.04, while the push/pop commands are pushing onto the stack and removing from the stack, they are failing to paste, and this is true for plain text.  I have tried using control-alt-c/v and control-command-c/v, copying and pasting from `gedit`.  In both cases, it's the same issue.

comment.body:
@hluk / 

```
$ echo $GDMSESSION
ubuntu-xorg
$ echo $XDG_SESSION_TYPE 
x11
```

I'm running X.

issue.title: Sometimes when the shortcut key brings up the main interface, the display is blank
issue.body:
Before creating a new issue, see list of [known
issues](https://copyq.readthedocs.io/en/latest/known-issues.html).

**Describe the bug**
Sometimes when the shortcut key brings up the main interface, the display is blank

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. The 'Show/Hide Main Window' shortcut key has been set, such as alt+v
2. Then use it normally
3. Use shortcut keys to bring up the main window
4. See the main window is blank：
![image](https://github.com/hluk/CopyQ/assets/93979778/1238b4bb-c880-4e8d-a0c3-d4ecb4bb043e)


**Expected behavior**
Normal display of clipboard list

**Screenshots**


**Version, OS and Environment**
(Get details from `copyq version` command if possible.)
 - Application Version [e.g. 7.1.0]
 - OS [e.g. Windows]
```
版本	Windows 11 专业工作站版 Insider Preview
版本	23H2
安装日期	‎2023/‎10/‎7
操作系统版本	25967.1010
体验	Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.25967.1010.0
```
 - Desktop environment, window manager (if applicable)

**Additional context**
After restarting the application, restore to normal

comment.body: I also experience this bug. Quite often. I rolled back to version 7.0, and everything is fine in it.

issue.title: Open menu under the text area or text cursor
issue.body:
I spent a bit of time reading the docs/faq and couldn't find this info there.
I've been using the fcitx5 clipboard feature for a while, and it displays the clipboard history right under where the text area (where the text will be pasted), rather than where the mouse is. I was wondering if it'd be possible to achieve a similar behaviour on CopyQ.

comment.body:
This will be probably very difficult to implement for all supported systems and is probably not going to happen unless someone can help with the implementation.

That said, it is possible to use a custom script to monitor the text cursor/area position and a command in CopyQ to show the menu at the position.

Perhaps better solution would be using `fcitx5` (I'm not familiar with it), but below is a script to monitor the position using Atspi - unfortunately, it does not work in many apps and desktop environments:

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python3
import signal
import subprocess
import sys
from threading import Thread

import gi

gi.require_version("Atspi", "2.0")
from gi.repository import Atspi  # noqa: E402


COMMAND = ["copyq", "settings", "default_menu_position"]

class FocusMonitor:
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.listener = None

    def start(self):
        self.listener = Atspi.EventListener.new(
            self._eventWrapper, self._on_focus_changed
        )
        Atspi.EventListener.register(
            self.listener, "object:state-changed:focused"
        )
        Atspi.event_main()

    def stop(self):
        Atspi.EventListener.deregister(
            self.listener, "object:state-changed:focused"
        )
        Atspi.event_quit()

    def _on_focus_changed(self, event):
        is_focused = event.detail1 == 1
        if is_focused and event.source.role:
            pos = Atspi.Component.get_position(event.source, Atspi.CoordType.WINDOW)
            size = Atspi.Component.get_size(event.source)
            arg = f"{pos.x + size.x} {pos.y + size.y}"
            print(f"New position: {arg}")
            subprocess.check_call(COMMAND + [arg])

    def _eventWrapper(self, event, callback):
        return callback(event)


if __name__ == "__main__":
    print("Press CTRL+C to exit")
    m = FocusMonitor()
    try:
        thread = Thread(target=m.start)
        thread.start()
        thread.join()
    except KeyboardInterrupt:
        pass
    finally:
        m.stop()
        thread.join()
```

And CopyQ command to show menu at the custom position:

```ini
[Command]
Command="
    copyq:
    const itemCount = 10
    const conf = settings('default_menu_position')
    const pos = str(conf).split(' ')
    menu(tab()[0], itemCount, pos[0], pos[1])"
GlobalShortcut=meta+c
Icon=\xf0c9
IsGlobalShortcut=true
Name=Show menu
```

issue.body:
greetings kind regards
attached please find GIF demonstrate selection from list has no effect . the expected result is the selected item pasted to document .
thank you kindly

Looks like the tray panel still has focus. CopyQ sends the paste shortcut (Shift+Insert) to the focused app.

You can try enable "Focus last window" option in Preferences (if not enabled):

issue.title: Pop not working on Ubuntu 22.04
issue.body:
Regarding [push/pop](https://github.com/hluk/CopyQ/issues/597#issuecomment-1728895131) that you've helpfully posted [here](https://github.com/hluk/copyq-commands/blob/master/Global/README.md#pushpop-items).

On Ubuntu 22.04, while the push/pop commands are pushing onto the stack and removing from the stack, they are failing to paste, and this is true for plain text.  I have tried using control-alt-c/v and control-command-c/v, copying and pasting from `gedit`.  In both cases, it's the same issue.

comment.body:
Is that Wayland? Pasting does not work there out-of-the-box.

See: https://copyq.readthedocs.io/en/latest/known-issues.html#on-linux-global-shortcuts-pasting-or-clipboard-monitoring-does-not-work

issue.title: Autostart is not working with flatpak install
issue.body:
Autostart is not working with flatpak install 


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Preferences'
2. Click on 'autostart' checkbox
3. reboot
4. CopyQ does not start automatically and ~/.config/autostart does not have an entry for copyq

**Expected behavior**
CopyQ should start automatically.


**Version, OS and Environment**
 - Application Version 6
 - OS Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS
 - Desktop environment, Gnome shell 42.9

comment.body:
> > So the linter still doesn't allow me to use this. I think what it means is that it should not be handled by the application itself: [flathub/flatpak-builder-lint#87](https://github.com/flathub/flatpak-builder-lint/issues/87)
> 
> So you are telling me we can’t use the preferences in CopyQ to activate autostart? The recommended way is to pass the —filesystem option to create it? That’s not very user friendly.

The recommended way seems to be to configure the autostart in your desktop environment (for example: https://code.whatever.social/questions/64444987/how-can-i-set-a-flatpak-application-to-run-on-startup).

I'm not very familiar with all this, but I cannot now configure the flatpak app to access `~/.config/autostart/` anyway due to the linter not accepting the spec with `--filesystem=xdg-config/autostart:create` before building the flatpak.

So you are telling me we can’t use the preferences in CopyQ to activate autostart? The recommended way is to pass the —filesystem option to create it? That’s not very user friendly.

commits.message:
Linux: Add build option to disable autostart (#2518)

Autostart option should not be available for example for flatpack apps
since it is handled by a background portal.

Fixes #2517

pull_request.title: Linux: Add build option to disable autostart
pull_request.body:

Fixes #2517

comment.body:
> Maybe the reason is that I removed `--filesystem=xdg-config/autostart:create` from the flatpak spec (last year). I think it was because the linter complained: [flathub/com.github.hluk.copyq@480fb36](https://github.com/flathub/com.github.hluk.copyq/commit/480fb369f3f08ee0d6373ba66824643431877558)

Yup, that's the reason. All works if I start the flatpak app with the following command:

```
flatpak run --filesystem=xdg-config/autostart:create com.github.hluk.copyq
```

Let me try to revert the change in the spec file.

issue.title: Copyq refuses to start: QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

Since few days ago copyq crashes and refuses to start. I run it on DEBUG mode with:

```console
❯ COPYQ_LOG_LEVEL='DEBUG' COPYQ_LOG_FILE="/tmp/copyq.log" LC_ALL="en_US.UTF-8" copyq
```

And the output is the following (ad-infinitum):

```
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.281] : [default] QtWarning: Detected locale "C" with character encoding "ANSI_X3.4-1968", which is not UTF-8.
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.281] :    Qt depends on a UTF-8 locale, and has switched to "C.UTF-8" instead.
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.281] :    If this causes problems, reconfigure your locale. See the locale(1) manual
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.281] :    for more information.
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.540] <Server-363272>: Server "/home/gerard/.config/copyq/.copyq_s" started.
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.585] <Server-363272>: Geometry: Window "MainWindow": Restore geometry "Options/MainWindow_geometry": 645x421,0,0 -> 951x693,500,64
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.590] <Server-363272>: Focus window is "COPYQ_LOG_LEVEL='DEBUG' COPYQ_LOG_FILE="/tmp/copyq.log" LC_ALL="en_US.UTF-8" "
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.612] <Server-363272>: Loading configuration
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.679] <Server-363272>: Configuration loaded
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.682] <Server-363272>: Starting monitor
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.685] <Server-363272>: Executing: copyq --clipboard-access monitorClipboard
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.688] <Server-363272>: Starting callback: onStart
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.692] <Server-363272>: Executing: copyq onStart
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.704] <Server-363272>: Tab "cli&pboard": Loading items from: /home/gerard/.config/copyq/copyq_tab_XXXXXXXXXXXXXX==.dat
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.720] : [default] QtWarning: Detected locale "C" with character encoding "ANSI_X3.4-1968", which is not UTF-8.
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.720] :    Qt depends on a UTF-8 locale, and has switched to "C.UTF-8" instead.
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.720] :    If this causes problems, reconfigure your locale. See the locale(1) manual
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.720] :    for more information.
CopyQ DEBUG [2023-10-18 12:38:56.727] <Server-363272>: Tab "cli&pboard": 500 items loaded from: /home/gerard/.config/copyq/copyq_tab_XXXXXXXXXXXXXX==.dat
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.730] : [default] QtWarning: Detected locale "C" with character encoding "ANSI_X3.4-1968", which is not UTF-8.
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.730] :    Qt depends on a UTF-8 locale, and has switched to "C.UTF-8" instead.
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.730] :    If this causes problems, reconfigure your locale. See the locale(1) manual
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.730] :    for more information.
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:56.864] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.404] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.407] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.410] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.412] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.415] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.419] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.422] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.425] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.428] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.431] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.434] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.438] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function
CopyQ Warning [2023-10-18 12:38:57.441] <Server-363272>: [default] QtWarning: Broken filename passed to function

[...]
```

### More context

💡 If I rename the file shown in the log `copyq_tab_XXXXXXXXXXXXXX==.dat`, so clearing `clipboard`-tab history, CopyQ works again, so I think this could be a bug.

**Version, OS and Environment**

```
❯ copyq version  
Warning: [default] QtWarning: Detected locale "C" with character encoding "ANSI_X3.4-1968", which is not UTF-8.
Warning:    Qt depends on a UTF-8 locale, and has switched to "C.UTF-8" instead.
Warning:    If this causes problems, reconfigure your locale. See the locale(1) manual
Warning:    for more information.
CopyQ Clipboard Manager 7.1.0
Qt: 6.5.3
Compiler: GCC
Arch: x86_64-little_endian-lp64
OS: Ubuntu 23.04
```
Window system: X11
Installed via Nix package manager.

---

For the locale Qt warnings I don't know how to fix them, I think it is not important, but here is my `locale` output:

```
❯ locale
LANG=en_US.UTF-8
LANGUAGE=
LC_CTYPE="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_NUMERIC=es_ES.UTF-8
LC_TIME=es_ES.UTF-8
LC_COLLATE="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_MONETARY=es_ES.UTF-8
LC_MESSAGES="en_US.UTF-8"
LC_PAPER=es_ES.UTF-8
LC_NAME=es_ES.UTF-8
LC_ADDRESS=es_ES.UTF-8
LC_TELEPHONE=es_ES.UTF-8
LC_MEASUREMENT=es_ES.UTF-8
LC_IDENTIFICATION=es_ES.UTF-8
LC_ALL=

```

comment.body:
> What do you mean by filename in this context?

I assume it is the absolute file path to the tab data file that for some reason contains the null character. But it could also be a problem in another file path/name, especially if [Synchronization](https://copyq.readthedocs.io/en/latest/synchronize.html) is enabled for the tab.

If you can debug with a debugger, place a break point on the line below and print check the stack trace: https://github.com/hluk/CopyQ/blob/19e9dd1c2ecb49b14a24159c5ac3bc1b77fdf250/src/common/messagehandlerforqt.cpp#L49
